name: Hilton San Francisco Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very posh reception area. Great location and very easy to locate. It has Starbucks in the reception foyer which is great.
reviews.title: Frisco

reviews.text: Basic amenities, small room, small bathroom, pool is very basic. Nicer lobby. No restaurant, just a Starbucks. Not bad location, but almost on the edge of rougher area. Good amenities in the area. I would recommend this if the price is right, but wouldn't pay $$$ to stay here.
reviews.title: not bad, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location-only a few blocks from Union Station(visitors centre inside) and a big mall(with huge food court). Lots of good restaurants nearby. Laundromat a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Good, but I expect better from the Hilton

reviews.text: Not so good location-right next to Tenderloin District=LOTS of homeless people.
reviews.title: Great location, Great Hotel

reviews.text: Restaurant in hotel did not have much on their menu.
reviews.title: Pretty nice hotel - especially for frequent Hilton travelers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hope the people over at Hilton are reading this... Emmy, who works at the front desk, provided the absolute best customer service- with a smile- that I have received at a hotel lately. The first room we checked in to (Tower 1) was a little run down- the tub was chipped, etc. Good view, but not great room. She switched us to a room in Tower 2- about the same caliber room for a view of the side of a building. On the third try (and she never once complained or hesitated to get us a room we liked) we were moved to a room in Tower 1 with a balcony. Absolutely superb view.
reviews.title: Unbeatable view from Tower 1

reviews.text: The full breakfast buffet breakfast was a $7 upgrade (I had a certificate for a continental breakfast since I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member) but worth it- not the greatest breakfast I ever had, but an adequate start to the day.
reviews.title: Great Location but Expensive and small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again- fantastic location, unbeatable view, excellent customer service. I hope Hilton is reading- Emmy deserves a commendation!
reviews.title: Change for the worse !

reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location for shopping in San Fran. However tt's expensive with small rooms. Roof top resturant is worth a visit!
reviews.title: Crappiest hotel I have been in in a long time
fantastic view
reviews.text: This hotel is a Hilton in name only. If I were CEO of the company I would distance myself from this property fast. There is no bar or restuarant in the hotel for the guest. At the desk they suggest a bar down a dingy hallway which has street access. They no longer have a rooftop restuarant or a Honors club. The staff is good but they are aware of the complaints of the frequent travelers.
Stayed 4 nights at the Hilton in O'Farrell Street. Lovely hotel, large rooms and all the amenities of the Hilton Hotels.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a top location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal, don't usually stay at Hiltons on our holildays.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, round the corner from Union Square, all the shops and restaurants and the cable car turnaround. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Skip this place..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a recent stay at this hotel in late September 2008. Loved the location of this hotel, no more than a 10 minute walk from Union Square. From which you could shop, eat, catch the fabled Cable Car, buses, trams, and muni.
reviews.title: Great location, too expensive

reviews.text: I must give major props to Miguel, the concierge. Was more than helpful in arranging a Wine Country Tour and recommending places for breakfast and dinner. Loved Lori's Diner around the corner (Humberto is the best!!!)
reviews.title: Mixed Bag

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay while in town to see the Tutankhmun Exhibit and got this hotel on Priceline for $70. It was a real value at that. We waited a few moments at the front desk while staff chatted with each other, but as soon as the shorter lady saw us around the plants, she greeted us and thanked us for waiting. Rooms were snug (the bathroom made me feel like I had visited Japan), but it was adequate space and the beds/pillows were very comfortable. Two luggage racks was a nice feature to accomodate both my friend's bag and mine. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. Parking here is $52.50 a day, so we parked at Best Parking around the corner on Jones Street for $20. We had dinner at Santorini (yummy Mediterranean), right down O'Farrell toward Union Square and breakfast at the Olympic Torch Cafe up on Geary (?). I'd recommend both. All together a nice stay and a good bargain.
reviews.title: Good location with normal quality you'd expect from Hilton

reviews.text: Great stay. Enjoyed the staff and the rooms.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Hotel had all you could want from hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel within walking distance to restaurants, shops, bart station, and union square park.

reviews.text: Good prices
reviews.title: First stay at Hilton proves to be an enjoyable experience.

reviews.text: This is the first time staying at this hotel. The price is reasonable compared to the other high end hotels. The hotel is located within walking distance to great restaurants, shopping, bart station, and the Union Square park. Our room was the standard room with the basic ammenities. It faced O'Farrel which was mainly a view of the street and parking structure. Staff was friendly. Valet was quick to retrieve the car.
reviews.title: Great service and view of the city.

reviews.text: I stayed at the SF Hilton for a business trip. I was able to view a couple of rooms as I moved from one room to another, due to location issues. As one expects with a large hotel, it appears some of the Hilton rooms have not been updated for a while. My current room has furniture that looks like it has reached replacement time. Certainly usable and clean but with visible wear and tear.
reviews.title: Great location but some rooms look tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice stay at the Hilton. We enjoyed the room and the full breakfast that was included in our room rate. The bathrooms were a bit small, but other than that.....and great room!!
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located. It is clean, has courteous and polite staff. Breakfast at the restaurant was included with my stay - good quality food and large variety.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Great location - convenient to a multitude of shops and restaurants. Beds were comfortable and the front desk service exemplary.
reviews.title: I would stay here again!

reviews.text: went to San Francisco on a business trip and stayed at the Hilton at Union Square. Nice rooms, although a little small. Great location. Walking distance to lots of shopping and dining. All the hotel staff was professional, courteous, and efficient.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business or leisure

reviews.text: Went with b/f to his Wells Fargo thing. Service was excellent, room was much better than my Upper Manhattan stays. The storage was great; 2 walk ins. View very good; Bay Bridge. Lots of room for business gatherings. The breakfast bennies were marvelous! There is a Starbucks right there in the lobby. Starbucks, in the convenience of the lobby's beauty and climate control, is a few feet from "Urban Tavern". So, if Starbucks' loading up doesn't cut it, you got this great restaurant a few feet away where the staff is unexpectedly cordial and attentive. Urban Tavern breakfast buffet is loaded with comparatively SUPER protein and VITAMINS. There is the regular menu of buttermilk and wholewheat pancakes with bananas or blueberries, Vitamin B shots called Carotene, C, and Greek Yogurt with Honey. They even have dim sum; the meat stuffed moist rolls and soft shrimp/cabbage pork rolls. And check out the cheese lover's corner: artisan cheeses with smoked trout, pickled herring and fresh mozarella.
reviews.title: Just Another Business Trip
good choice
reviews.text: On the entry wall there is a pastry shelf; danishes, chocolate croissants, muffins, Et al., On another wall there are wonderful breakfast lineups; grilled potatoes, eggs benedict, and a plentiful fruit bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comparatively speaking, the gym is adequate for cardio, and just a step below marginal for free weights. Cables are allright.
reviews.title: Lobby looks fresh but rooms are a bit small and dated

reviews.text: Happy Hours at Urban Tavern were great too; nice environment, plenty of space.
reviews.title: Missing the amenities

reviews.text: p.s. This trip included wineries tours, Sausalito, and some walking around Union Square
reviews.title: Hilton San Francisco - Union Square

reviews.text: The hotel is just average. It's big with no character. It doesn't even have a hotel bar except for a few chairs in the lobby. Stay here only if you have to.
reviews.title: Average business hotel at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The concierges were all absolutely marvellous and informative.Our room was a little on the small side for two people but clean and comfortable.The hotel has a fantastic location and is within walking distance of many places of interest. If you can't walk to where you want to go, the hotel is near all the public transport you might need. We'd definitely go back there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.disliked: — the pool area wasn't very inviting

reviews.text: Easy to get to. Within walking distance from great fun, food, shopping, and entertainment. Starbucks in the lobby opens at 6, and I was there at 5:55, and by 5:57 there were 6 people behind me. Taxis are always waiting out front, but be sure to know where you want to go as the cabby's don't know everything about the city. If you have to, get directions from the concierge. Speaking of concierge, they were snotty, in a hurry, and unfriendly. I got what I needed, but it was not service with a smile.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.liked: — Walking distance to shopping, great food, art/ culture, and easy of freeway.
likes.disliked: — Close to the homeless, very large hotel, impersonal service.

reviews.text: The front desk staff was fine. Our room was a handicapped room, and we were not handicapped. Our shower did not work so we could not shower before dinner, but it was fixed by the time we got back. We asked for a room change, and it was not available. We asked for breakfast as a consolation but it was like pulling teeth to get it. They offered us movies, internet, and more, but in the end we got admittance to the Executive Lounge on the 40-something floor. The view was amazing. The food was edible. It was very crowded.
reviews.title: A great hotel, but beware the hidden costs.

likes.liked: — Location, the rooms were great and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — The hidden costs that made it much more expensive than planned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. The housekeeping walked in on us twice. The view was a parking structure, but it is San Fran. Speaking of parking- EXPENSIVE! $45 a day! Consider parking in the structure across the street.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely above the average Hilton standards (which are rather low in general these last years). Upgraded to executive thanks to HHonors status, excellent lounge with great views of San Francisco. Nice room with a balcony (that's rare enough to mention it!) and beautiful city view. Large central pool, not very intimate though since it's in the middle of the hotel central court.
reviews.title: A very good Hilton with good value for money. (With nice views from the rooms)

reviews.text: A good hotel and definitely a fair deal if you book in advance.
reviews.title: nice room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a high-end luxury hotel indeed but a very comfortable and friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Excellent View

reviews.text: Comfy bed and spacious room! We spent a night across the street at the Hotel Nikko before switching for better accomodations at the Hilton. Would be nice if they didn't charge for the gym...
reviews.title: Best place to stay!

reviews.text: Always a great place to stay. Walking distance to all downtown locations. Good security and friendly staff. Been staying here for many years and many more in the future!
reviews.title: Grand central station in downtown San Francisco

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay at the beginning of a 3 week road trip in California. Overall a good choice - Room was OK space-wise although a bit cramped for a family of 4 with luggage. Nice to have the balcony overlooking the city. Good comfortable beds and excellent maid service though the reception/bar area was more akin to a bus station than anything else with literally hoards of people coming and going - definitely not the place for a quiet drink! - This hotel is in a great location, close to Union Square and Market Street. Avoid the hotel breakfast which is massively overpriced especially at their is an excellent diner just across the street on Taylor.
reviews.title: Good location...
Close to everything, but watch out
reviews.text: The Hilton seems to be well run- very knowledgeable staff who were extremely helpful. The decor and personality of the room is standard- don't expect to be wow'ed with SF character or architecture- the room had none of this- just the basic necessities a hotel room would, a slight disappoint. The hotel is very close to Union Square, which can either be a good thing or a bad thing, depending what you are looking for. It is extremely close to a mission (south of the main entrance) where they feed homeless people and I made that mistake when Im suddenly in the midst of people holding drug paraphernalia out in the open- not a very good place for kids- was very dicey and sketchy. My biggest gripe was the per day parking- a whopping $52 a day. Completely outrageous. I felt like I had been swindled. I dont see myself ever staying at another Hilton after that 3 days of parking. Terrible to see a worldwide chain take advantage of people that way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice but maybe a bit dated. We first got a room next to the elevator shafts. The elevator engines were very noisy so we switched rooms which was simple and easy.
reviews.title: An average experience

reviews.text: We had a view of the pool. Although we never used it, it seemed very crowded as well as the rest of the hotel. We stayed for a weekend in July so it was packed with tourists. So it is not a very personal experience if that is what you are looking for.
reviews.title: Bad front desk service experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As several already have pointed out, the hotel parking is very expensive (as it always is) so it is cheaper to use one of the nearby parkings.
reviews.title: Pet-Friendly? NO! Rude? YES! Costumer is not right here!

reviews.text: I was at the Hilton for a week long conference. I just read other reviews and agree mostly. Very clean rooms, wonderful beds to sleep in, but...the rooms are small. The bathroom doors are a pain (french doors on a bathroom are not nice). Since the hotel is used for conferences quite often, i am shocked there is not better internet provided. No wireless and then a business Kinko's that is rather expensive. I am glad my conference set up free computers for us to get on the internet.
reviews.title: Clean, but...

likes.disliked: — Lack of internet and staff walking in

reviews.text: I also had the hotel staff walk in the room on two occasions. Yes, they do knock but before you are to the door they are entering. My roommate was in the bathroom at the time, so you can imagine if i wasn't there to stop them from entering how embarrassing that would be. Can you imagine if you were dressing?!
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton!

likes.disliked: — room & bathroom were a little small

reviews.text: Numerous escalators were out of service through the whole week. No elevator problems though and we used them often being on the 17th floor.
reviews.title: Not good enough for a Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby was always packed, noisy, and uninviting because of this. Homeless outside were very annoying asking for change all the time. We did not have a car to park.
reviews.title: Nice Average Hotel

reviews.text: In hotel restaurant is very expensive and not many choices. But other eateries are very close by. Concierge desk was very helpful! Asked the front desk to not deliver newspaper 3 times and we still got it every day, just gave up in the end.
reviews.title: Better than I thought

likes.disliked: — No good bar for relaxing or to use as a good meeting spot for the people on our group

reviews.text: In the heart of Union Square, we always go to this hotel to experience wonderful customer service, spacious and lovely junior suite and the nearness of everything fun!
reviews.title: Wonderful customer service, spacious jr. suite near everything!

reviews.text: Pros: The staff was very polite and looked to help at every turn.
reviews.title: Great Service/staff, but why do I have to pay to exercise?

reviews.text: The restaurant served some great food.
reviews.title: always feel like Home sweet Home

reviews.text: The room and general areas were clean and in order.
reviews.title: One of the nicest Hilton's I've stayed at. Wish my trip was longer

reviews.text: Cons: The restaurant, especially for breakfast, was too expensive. $21 for a bagel??
reviews.title: Covenient Hotel for the conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sinking into our queen-size mattress was heavenly -- it wasn't too hard, it wasn't too soft -- and I slept even better during our one-night stay than I do at home. My only regret is that we couldn't check in earlier so I could have taken a nap in that bed.
reviews.title: I slept the sleep of the dead on that mattress

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also really appreciated the efficient, courteous room service we received when I discovered I'd left all our toiletries at home. Need a toothbrush, toothpaste and dental floss? No problem! Someone arrived at our door within 10 minutes with the necessities.
reviews.title: Rude rude rude

reviews.text: And we enjoyed a stellar FREE breakfast from the cafe -- it's billed as a "continental" breakfast but was way more food than what I've had at any other hotel -- a large latte, small orange juice, piece of fruit and a scone. Doesn't get better than that. I can't imagine why anyone would step foot in the ridiculously overpriced in-hotel restaurant ($18.50 for French toast? Get real) with this option available.
reviews.title: Location is the sole merit

reviews.text: I have been meaning to write a review on this place for ages - stayed last Sept and would never stay here again. Got to the room we were given to find key didn't work - went back to he desk and the girl was so rude - it was like it was my fault - but it was HER colleague who wrote the wrong number. First room as dull and horrible - second room was just as bad - and we could hear everything from the room above - including ever time they flushed - which seemed to be freq during the nite. God location - but that's it. On leaving did they ask if we'd had a good stay - did they hell......stay somewhere else......dull dull dull......I'd give this no stars
reviews.title: We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton SF Union Square with my parents and younger nephew for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

aka: Hilton San Francisco Union Square Hotel San Francisco
description: Our hotel is within walking distance to all the excitement of the Bay Area. Whether you're on business or vacation, there's something for everyone in the heart of the city! Among downtown San Francisco hotels, no other destination matches our blend of style, service, and setting. Find yourself within walking distance to famous neighborhoods like Chinatown and Nob Hill, the iconic Cable Cars, fabulous shopping, and dining all located in the heart of the theater district. Our dynamic Hilton San Francisco Union Square hotel features splendid resort-style touches – a heated outdoor pool and whirlpool perched atop the lush 16th floor deck, and delicious dining at the stylish Urban Tavern Restaurant. For corporate guests, we offer over 134,000 square feet of state-of-the-art meeting facilities, where the Bay views are stunning and the service flawless. With its history and grandeur, the Hilton San Francisco Union Square hotel offers everything you need for extraordinary business trips or vacations.
